name: Frank's Spicy Alabama Onion Beer Chili
author: EVILCHEF
summary: Spicy beef, onion, and beer chili recipe I picked up while in Alabama. Many people have asked me for the recipe so I'm posting it here. Enjoy! Adjust the amount of jalapenos and other spicy things to suit your taste.
ingredients: 2 (14.5 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with juice
3 tablespoons hot pepper sauce (e.g. Tabasco™), or to taste
4  fresh jalapeno peppers, seeded and chopped
3 tablespoons red pepper flakes, or to taste  (Optional)
directions: Crumble the ground chuck into a skillet over medium heat
Cook, stirring occasionally until evenly browned
Transfer the beef to a large soup pot
Add onions, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, beer and chili beans
Season with Worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, chili powder, jalapenos, and red pepper flakes, if using
Cover the pot, and simmer over low heat for 2 hours
Turn off heat, and let cool, then refrigerate for two days
It gets much better with time
